Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

The SEIT Autonomy team is responsible for all testing and initial troubleshooting of the autonomy software, from development to release, using simulation, track, and public road testing. This position could result in assignment to one of multiple sub-teams. We work with individual software teams to create and execute tests across all testing modalities to ensure new features and updates work as designed prior to code delivery. The team also maintains and executes test plans designed to verify and validate system requirements in all autonomy feature areas. Operational teams are responsible for vehicle regression testing and troubleshooting of software release candidates prior to public road evaluation. We ensure the autonomy system is working as expected, communicate problem reports back to the development team, communicate significant code updates to the operational fleet and help to develop and promote Argo safety culture.

What you'll do:
Lead a medium sized team of Test Engineers in simulation, closed course, and public road testing environments
Work with engineers from all disciplines to plan and execute tests around targeted functional areas, in structured settings
Plan and manage routine operational tasks, work packages toward quarterly goals and other company objectives as required
Communicate with hardware and software teams across multiple cities and locations to coordinate testing
Prepare and present testing analysis and reports
Interface and report relevant software issues to the specific teams as necessary
Improve and maintain testing documentation and processes
Coordinate with other Test and Integration teams to prepare tests and training for new features that are landing from development branches
Report status to leads and upper management on a regular basis

What we're looking for:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experience with JIRA or other similar ticketing systems
Experience managing field operations in remote locations a plus
Experience in an Engineering or other related field with technical team management
Autonomy testing experience is preferred but not required
Experience working with engineers to integrate test equipment a plus

At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.

Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. At Argo AI, you can expect stellar perks to support your best self:

High-quality individual and family health, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan
Paid parental leave
Unlimited vacation
Daily catered lunches and snacks
Free onsite or adjacent parking
Commuter reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Professional development reimbursement

Argo AI is a LinkedIn Top 50 Startup

job_title_2: Computer Vision Architect, Senior Manager - Applied Artificial Intelligence
job_description:
Strategy & Analytics-Analytics and Cognitive

Computer Vision Architect, Senior Manager

Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.

The team
Analytics & Cognitive
In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting enterprise programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

The Analytics & Cognitive team works with our clients to:
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based as well as client-owned platforms
Deploy automation and cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Qualifications:
10+ years of relevant work experience
4+ years of experience leading and managing project teams
2+ full cycle product experiences (prototype to production) deploying computer vision solutions
API development experience
Bachelor's or Advanced Degree
Travel up to 80-100% of the time (Monday – Thursday/Friday) (While 80-100% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)

Preferred:
Advanced Degree preferably in applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, data science, electrical engineering, physics, or closely related field
Formal training in one or many of the following: computer vision, image processing, linear and non-linear programming, machine learning, linear algebra
Certification or expertise on at least one of the following platforms: Google Vision, AWS Rekognition, Azure Computer Vision/Face/Content Moderator, or Watson Visual Recognition
Expertise in computer vision or deep learning frameworks and libraries, e.g. PyTorch, OpenCV, Keras, Tensorflow, scikit-image
Advanced skills in Python
Strong knowledge of machine learning, deep learning, image processing, computer vision
Experience with quantitative modeling (design, development & implementation) using 3+ types of algorithms (e.g., YOLOv3, RetinaNet, Faster R-CNN)
Expertise in fields e.g. structured information extraction, object detection, action recognition, image segmentation, spatiotemporal modeling (hybrid CNN/RNN)
Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with ability to exercise mature judgment.

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.


Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

Company Description

ULC Robotics is a dynamic company growing at a fast pace. We are a leader in product development and engineering services for the natural gas, energy, industrial, and electric markets. We are committed to solving operations and maintenance problems while protecting the environment, reducing costs, increasing efficiency, and improving safety.
We re a global company of thinkers, problem solvers, designers and makers. We each play a unique role. Built on a legacy of innovation, ULC robotics is committed to leading the utility robotics revolution and has been since our start in 2001. We foster an environment which encourages the exchange of ideas and inspires change by challenging traditional thought and approaches to problem-solving. Though we are constantly evolving to meet the complex demands of our industry, we remain dedicated to creating an impact, locally and globally, through meaningful work. We are proud of how our technology helps utilities minimize their impact on the environment and the public while lowering operating costs.

We develop new technologies today, so we can change tomorrow.
Join ULC and be at the forefront of change!

If you have a passion to protect our environment, improve safety, and increase operational efficiencies and seek new challenges, this is the job for you.

Ideally, we are looking for someone with an engineering background in electrical and mechanical engineering with experience designing and integrating complex systems. You are best suited for this role if you enjoy both technical and managerial roles and are passionate about developing technology to solve problems. You are an engineer with a strong technical background seeking to take your career to the next level or an experienced project manager with a varied set of backgrounds and experiences. Someone detail-oriented with a knack for solving problems and not shy to interact with clients is ideal. You can manage a constantly changing, varied task load with minimal supervision. A team-oriented and proactive attitude is essential
What does a day in the life of a Project Manager look like for ULC Robotics?
You will collaborate with engineering teams to solve technical challenges for our clients. Review project performance for completion on time, budget and to the highest level of quality. A prospective candidate will coordinate developing customer requirements, test plans, and procedures and generate project reports, proposals and presentations. This position will be integral role in reviewing new opportunities and helping the team to plan and acquire new projects.
To be successful, you will have the following:

Bachelor s degree in appropriate Engineering disciple (Electrical, Mechanical, Robotics) required
3+ years of overall engineering experience required
Direct experience working with an engineering group with a strong engineering background in high-tech fields
Experience in more than one area of product development: prototyping, design, fabrication, integration, and testing
Exemplary verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to travel domestically
Authorization to work in the United States- may consider sponsorship


Having any of the following is a plus:

A master s or Ph.D. degree in engineering
Work and/or academic experience with robotics development
Innovative and creative mindset and a background depicting excellence in innovation – examples would be patents, publications, and cool personal projects
Knowledge and/or experience in one or more of the following areas: Control Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Sensors, Robotics
Experience writing proposals

Benefits

Our team is motivated, dedicated and thrives on developing industry-leading products and services that can transform the way our clients work. We foster a unique work environment that inspires employees to express their ideas and work collaboratively towards finding innovative solutions to problems. We attract top talent by offering some of the best benefits in the industry. Some of the benefits we offer our team are listed below:

Medical Insurance with gym membership reimbursement
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
401(k)
4 weeks of PTO on an annual basis (prorated on date of hire)
Aflac Insurance
Casual dress code
EOE/disability/veteran

Req. ID: 195461

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.
Micron Consumer Products Group is a division of Micron, one of the world’s largest memory and flash storage manufacturers. Based out of Meridian, Idaho with additional international locations, the group primarily operates under the Crucial brand selling to large channel partners and direct via its website where it has a strong presence in North America, Europe, and Asia.
We are recruiting for an exciting position within our global marketing team, tasked with managing the group’s insight and analytics function. Reporting directly to the Sr Manager, Performance Marketing & Insight, you will manage a small team responsible for setting a solid foundation for decision making at a worldwide level. You will help to drive the optimization of digital marketing campaigns alongside the performance marketing managers, whilst simultaneously improving the digital journey by finding opportunities directly from digital analytics and customer feedback. You will also be responsible for identifying any wider market trends and diving into competitor strategies by working with third party providers, ensuring that leadership are kept informed of any key changes.

An analytical problem solver with a passion for helping people understand the “why” from data, you will also need a developed sense of business insight to help guide your analytical approach. You should be comfortable challenging the status quo in order to find and implement new and better ways to look at data.

A highly effective communicator, numerate, detail oriented, and organized, you will have a strong solid understanding of Microsoft Excel, SQL, and Tableau along with a data analysis related degree. You’ll also be as passionate about new technology and computers as our customers are. Previous exposure to a digital marketing function, digital analytics, and customer research is desirable.

Responsibilities and Tasks:
Driving an outstanding insight team capable of setting the basis for a data-driven approach to digital marketing
Leading and prioritizing the workload of the insight team to ensure high quality analysis and reporting are delivered on time
Training and upskilling of insight team members, providing support where required
Owning the relationship with all third-party data, research, and analytics providers
Influencing the strategy of the wider performance marketing team, identifying key areas for optimizing our digital advertising investments
Working with performance marketing, web, and brand teams to highlight areas for improvement across all aspects of the digital journey using agency data, web analytics, customer feedback, and UX testing
Keeping on top of new market and competitor trends, reporting back to the team and leadership where appropriate on any changes
Identifying innovative solutions to improve on current reporting, data visualization, and data warehousing processes
Overseeing the distribution of weekly/monthly/quarterly critical metric reporting and analysis for the marketing team

Skills and Experience:
Analytical problem solver with strong attention to detail
Excellent organization, communication and presentation skills
Proactive, flexible and able to work autonomously
Strong project leadership skills
Comfortable working in a global team
Strong Tableau and Microsoft Excel knowledge for reporting, data manipulation and analysis
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (or equivalent) to combine, aggregate and extract data
Confident working with large volumes of data, ensuring integrity is maintained in the flow across raw files and a database
Prior exposure to digital analytics tools
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Data analysis related degree

About Micron Technology, Inc.
We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers.

About the role…
wayForward is a startup on a mission to provide mental healthcare access to everyone, globally!
Note: We are very actively hiring in response to COVID-19 demand for our solutions.
Emotional and mental health problems on a spectrum and not everyone needs the same care. wayForward untangles access to emotional wellness and mental health care for employees and members. We identify member needs and deliver personalized care, both digital and traditional. Our solution is delivered via a mobile and web app-based platform. We use Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to improve and augment end-users’ and healthcare providers’ experiences.
We’re looking for an exceptional, self-directed and energetic product manager, who brings their creativity and experience to drive the next generation of our product. You’ll sit at the convergence of product, clinical, operations, engineering, sales, and data to figure out how we can continuously make the best product experiences for our end-users and customers.
Working closely with the CEO, you’ll have ownership of the strategic approach and roadmap, and be responsible for driving execution to achieve objectives.

Work with key stakeholders to create a clear and compelling medium and long-term vision for the product

Understand business needs to prioritize requests and ideas, and ship experiments to test bold product hypotheses
Drive the product development process from ideation to launch to impact analysis, collaborating with other teams along the way
Use data to discover and justify investments as well as to analyze their impact
Define OKRs, track progress, and measure the impact of the team’s efforts against business goals
Be a positive contributor to the team at large, e.g., help foster an environment of continuous learning, mentor team members, etc.
About wayForward
We are a rapidly growing startup in the mental health and wellness space. Since 2017, we’ve covered 500K lives and projecting to grow to over 1 million within a year. Our solutions are used primarily by employers.

We’d love to hear from you if…

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as :
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Program Manager. Small company style so you'll wear Product Owner, Project Manager and Software System Engineer hats
LOCATION: Work Remote- work from anywhere USA. Ideal cities; Washington, DC area, Orlando FL, Denver, CO. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Program Manager
We are looking to bring on a dedicated Senior Program Manager (aka Product Owner / Software System Engineer) to work closely with our software developers on our primary software applications that include web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts, as well as backend components with custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This web-based system encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, COA analytics, wargaming, and integration with other military and simulation systems. As the feature set grows, we need to ensure that user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the military users can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.

In this role, you will become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) of military Courses of Action analysis, wargaming and simulation software systems. Prior military tactical experience and/or understanding of the military operations and capabilities would be a strong asset, although not required.

You will communicate with the clients to assist with gathering feedback and new requirements and decomposing them into actionable, well-defined user stories and tasks. You will work with the development team to design solutions to customer needs, help document the system and feature design, and communicate it with key stakeholders outside of the company. You will take part in design of UI/UX and military modeling for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs, feedback, and your own recommendations for usability improvements. You will work directly with the development team to manage and prioritize backlog, track developer progress and guide them in making decisions to ensure end software closely matches user needs. As a superuser of our software you will use the software, communicate insights for the development team, and demonstrate the functionality to the current or prospective customers. You will support our integration efforts through close communication with the product owners and software engineers of the other companies to make sure that the end product fits customer needs, and to represent and advocate for the technical approach designed by our development team.

Key Skills to Have
Military experience. Officer level and tactical strongly preferred
Technically savvy
Excellent communicator
Dependable, creative, and detail oriented
Great Experience to Have, Some Combination needed
Modeling and Simulation
Representing technical team in meetings
Capturing user needs
Managing the development backlog
Planning the work of software developers
Software development experience
Technical writing
UI/UX design
Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

A new technology paradigm is emerging, one with an intelligent cloud and an intelligent edge. In this new paradigm, artificial intelligence (AI) will be pervasive across devices, apps, and infrastructure to drive insights and act on your behalf. To foster Microsoft’s leadership in this field, we created a groundbreaking program to develop the next generation of leaders in AI.

Located at the Microsoft New England Research and Development Center (NERD), the Microsoft’s AI Development Acceleration Program hires top candidates from undergraduate, graduate, and PhD programs. Over the course of 2 years, participants work in multi-discipline teams and partner closely with engineering teams across Microsoft to solve some of our most challenging AI problems.

Our team is looking for a Software Engineering Leader to help us grow the next generation of Microsoft talent and build amazing AI-enabled experiences for our customers.

In this role, you’ll guide our efforts by leading our software engineers, working with our partners to identify and build strategic examples of AI innovation, and delivering a framework for integration of our modules into Microsoft’s AI Platform. As a senior engineering leader on our team, you will shape our program’s development life cycle and establish best practices. You’ll also help hire and nurture our incredibly talented and diverse team.

We embrace a culture which is customer focused, collaborative, fun loving and iterative—one that delivers continuously and drives engineering excellence. If you are a software engineer who is passionate about developing people and looking to have a huge impact at Microsoft in AI, this could be your ideal role.
Responsibilities
Recruit and lead a group of new-to-career software engineers focused on advancing Microsoft’s AI capabilities by working on projects sourced from product teams across the company.
Partner with multiple engineering and business partners to ensure that the solutions meet their business goals and can be successfully integrated into their codebase.
Create an inclusive work environment where every employee can effectively engage and wants to be part of the team. Provide ongoing feedback that helps your direct reports improve their performance.
Architect the framework for abstraction and reuse of our AI modules for integration into the AI platform, choose the appropriate internal or external technologies, incorporate research, create design and validation collateral, including test automations that are reused across the program.
Around 10% travel expected to stakeholder locations
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a practicing software engineer.
2+ years of experience as a technical lead, including mentoring and growing junior software engineers.

One or more of the following skills will be highly regarded:
BS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
1+ years of experience in building AI or data science platforms.
Experience consuming and contributing to open source software projects.
Experience working with distributed teams.

Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

The Executive Communications Lead is a key member of a team that provides comprehensive communication strategy and support to Micron’s CEO staff-level executives. In this role, you will serve as communications counsel to one of Micron’s senior executives, using your expertise to drive business results internally and elevate Micron’s brand presence externally. You will work with key partners to design and implement communication programs that build clarity, confidence and connection to our strategy for our team members and build our reputation and brand.

The ideal candidate will have a strong writing background, with an outstanding track record of working with senior executives in Fortune 500 companies. Executive presence, integrity and ability to influence and drive alignment at all levels is a must. Experience working in technology and/or semiconductors is highly desirable.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Act as the single point of contact for the senior executive’s communication needs, providing proactive and strategic communications advice, planning and implementation.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive communication platform that effectively articulates a distinct identity for the executive, both internally and externally.
Based on business objectives and in conjunction with key business partners, build and execute a comprehensive strategy for the executive that drives business results internally.
Identify strategic external executive communications opportunities to build our reputation and brand.
Draft speeches and talking points, messaging, video scripts, blogs and other materials for leader. Bring strong experience in writing for different formats, mediums and audiences including long-form, short-form; social media, web, video; external and internal audiences among others.
Support executive participation in company-wide all-hands, leadership meetings, and other experiential engagement experiences.
Collaborate with brand, editorial and content colleagues to provide timely input for relevant topics to be featured in external channels as appropriate.

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in journalism, marketing, communications, or related field.
A minimum of seven years of corporate, internal and executive communications experience at a Fortune 500 company.
Experience in high tech and/or semiconductor industry highly desired.
Demonstrated talent for high quality writing and content development, with samples to share.
Outstanding creative writing skills with ability to capture the executive’s voice and elevate their content and presence, including ability to simplify complex content and write in a clear, succinct and engaging format that adapts to audience needs.
Extensive background crafting, developing and successfully implementing comprehensive employee engagement and executive communication programs using multiple platforms and media.
Executive presence, professionalism and ability to influence and drive alignment at all levels.
Seasoned project management skills with ability to develop and execute multiple end-to-end programs concurrently and with little oversight.
Outstanding interpersonal communication skills and senior client relationship management experience. Solid team collaboration skills.
Solid experience with multimedia platforms, social media and visual storytelling.
Adaptability to needs and strategies of individual business units; tolerance for ambiguity; ability to take ownership and drive projects in a rapidly changing environment.

Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.

We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for passionate, talented, and experienced Product Managers to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”

As a product manager on our team, you will own products and features end-to-end that impact millions of customers. You will work directly with developers and customers to solve challenging problems using the latest technologies (NoSQL, AI, ML, Big Data, etc.). You will make data-driven decisions and prioritize how and when to build features and work with leadership across AWS to evangelize your products.

What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that loves working together towards a common goal.Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.Learn & Grow: If want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a life time.Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented pool of engineers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.Learn more about Amazon Connect here:
https://aws.amazon.com/connect/
Media coverage on Amazon Connect:
https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/28/aws-amazon-connect/
Power of Amazon Connect:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qky_E39-_I

Coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Our Customer strives to reduce their burden by replacing manual methods with technology enabled automated processes. So, as our customer becomes an even more "source rich" entity, the key to retaining the intelligence and operational advantage for the US and its allies is to leverage Machine/Deep Learning (ML/DL) and Computer Vision (CV) in the analytic environment. The entity who most effectively and quickly converts data into actionable intelligence has the advantage. The SAFFIRE effort enables our customer to define and establish workflows and methodologies which fully leverage investments already made in Activity Based Intelligence (ABI) and Structured Object Management (SOM) to maximize the analytic impact of applying CV for Automation, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Augmentation (AAA).

The position is to provide technical lead of the Structured Object Management (SOM) product.


Position is contingent upon program award expected in Summer 2020

This position requires an active TS/SCI security .

Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.
EXPERIENCE LEVEL:
Experienced Professional

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as :
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location
We are hiring for Raleigh, NC.
U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Military Veteran Modeling & Simulation Leader. Small company style so you'll wear Product Owner, Project Manager and Software System Engineer hats
LOCATION: Work Remote- work from anywhere USA. Ideal cities; Washington, DC area, Orlando FL, Denver, CO. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Military Veteran Modeling & Simulation Leader
We are looking to bring on a dedicated Veteran Leader (aka Product Owner / Software System Engineer) to work closely with our software developers on our primary software applications that include web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts, as well as backend components with custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This web-based system encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, COA analytics, wargaming, and integration with other military and simulation systems. As the feature set grows, we need to ensure that user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the military users can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.

In this role, you will become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) of military Courses of Action analysis, wargaming and simulation software systems. Prior military tactical experience and/or understanding of the military operations and capabilities would be a strong asset, although not required.

You will communicate with the clients to assist with gathering feedback and new requirements and decomposing them into actionable, well-defined user stories and tasks. You will work with the development team to design solutions to customer needs, help document the system and feature design, and communicate it with key stakeholders outside of the company. You will take part in design of UI/UX and military modeling for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs, feedback, and your own recommendations for usability improvements. You will work directly with the development team to manage and prioritize backlog, track developer progress and guide them in making decisions to ensure end software closely matches user needs. As a superuser of our software you will use the software, communicate insights for the development team, and demonstrate the functionality to the current or prospective customers. You will support our integration efforts through close communication with the product owners and software engineers of the other companies to make sure that the end product fits customer needs, and to represent and advocate for the technical approach designed by our development team.

Key Skills to Have
Strong Military experience; Officer level, Leader and tactical/combat strongly preferred, some combo required
Modeling and Simulation exp; wargaming preferred, training soldiers, mapping
Technically savvy
Excellent communicator
Dependable, creative, and detail oriented
Great Experience to Have, Some Combination needed
Representing technical team in meetings
Capturing user needs
Managing the development backlog
Planning the work of software developers
Software development experience
Technical writing
UI/UX design
Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

The Argo AI Software TPM team is a highly dynamic and cross-functional team. The team is responsible for the planning, technical cross-check, and plan execution of everything from lower level tasks to organizational level projects. This role will focus on supporting the different perception teams from Detection to Calibration and Localization. As a TPM, you will be responsible for leading planning and execution across multiple teams and initiatives within the Perception group to support the design, development, and optimization of new machine learning algorithms and AV software.

What you'll do:

Work with team leads, individual contributors, and other TPMs (Software and Hardware) to advance the Argo AI software products and processes
Work with perception teams to develop and optimize timing requirements, objectives, and interdependencies with activities such as, but not limited to: AV feature improvement and development, AV performance enhancements, traditional computer vision techniques and training and management of machine learning models
Develop detailed implementation plans, maintain alignment, and monitor program status across multiple activities to reduce or remove dependencies
Ensure timely delivery of deliverables and system capabilities according to an evolving, and faced-paced, program schedule
Maintain a strong technical understanding of the entirety of the program across the entire lifecycle

What we're looking for:

Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experience working with Machine Learning or Computer Vision techniques
Hands-on experience and strong background with modern project/software management processes and tools, e.g., agile, scrum, Jira/Rally, SmartSheets, and Google Suite
Hyper-organized mindset - able to be an influencer of projects to lead development, operations, and logistics toward a common goal
Works effectively under extreme pressure - consistently delivers excellent results and high output rates in a fast-paced environment

At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.

Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. At Argo AI, you can expect stellar perks to support your best self:

High-quality individual and family health, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan
Paid parental leave
Unlimited vacation
Daily catered lunches and snacks
Free onsite or adjacent parking
Commuter reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Professional development reimbursement

Argo AI is a LinkedIn Top 50 Startup

The Ads Delivery Team’s mission is to make every impression meaningful. We help advertisers to achieve business goals balanced with users’ goals of having the most engaging content and ads to view on Facebook. It’s having a big impact on the ecosystem and company revenue with a portfolio of products or platforms such as ads targeting, ads delivery, dynamic ads, prediction, simulation, ads score and optimizations.

TPMs can provide technical vision and leadership across teams to bring Ads Delivery Products to the next higher ground. Technical Program Manager, Ads Delivery Responsibilities Develop overall strategy, product roadmap and tactical business decisions for Ads Delivery products and platforms. Define and own metrics as key performance indicators that measure the impact of Ads Delivery Products. Establish shared goals with product teams across the company to get alignment and to drive optimal results for business, people, partners and Facebook. Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases. Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Provide day-to-day coordination and quality assurance for projects and tasks. Proactively identify, mitigate and manage risks to ensure success. Collaborate with Engineering, Product, Marketing, Design, Contents, Privacy and Data Science teams for product requirements, scope and implementation. Drive internal process improvements across multiple teams and functions. Own joint technical roadmap, prioritization and alignment. Minimum Qualifications B.S. Computer Sciences or 5+ years of Software Application development experience. 5+ years of experience working across functions (Engineering, Product Management, Legal) in order to deliver a product or features. 5+ years of organizational coordination experience in a technical company. 5 or more years of problem-solving experience with large scale technical systems. 5 or more years of experience understanding product requirements and translating those product needs into plans. Preferred Qualifications PMP Certification (PMI). Technical Industrial experience in large scale Machine learning/Artificial intelligence or scaling out data engineering and infrastructure. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
You will be responsible for supporting our customers located on the West Coast, and so working West Coast hours is something you are comfortable with.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com

job_title_2: Associate Manager, Federal Technology Leadership Programs
job_description:
ORGANIZATION
The Partnership for Public Service is a nonpartisan, nonprofit organization with a big mission: we’re working to ensure the federal government is dynamic, innovative and that it effectively serves the American people. We’ve got a great team that helps make it happen.
Our staff is diverse in experience and perspective, but at our core, we share a lot of the same traits. We are mission-driven, creative, collaborative, optimistic and inclusive.
Our work is strategic, fast-paced and guided by our values:
Passion for public service and our work toward a more effective government.
People who promote a culture of learning, leadership, collaboration, inclusion and respect.
Persistence to drive change, take strategic risks and deliver results.
Promise to be trustworthy, nonpartisan and fiscally responsible.
We hire smart and friendly people who are great at what they do and good to one another in the process.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Partnership for Public Service strengthens technological transformation in government by promoting buy-in amongst federal leadership for technological change; increasing understanding among public servants about emerging technologies and how they affect the work of agencies; and fostering the use of best practices and innovative hiring models to improve how government recruits, hires, retains, and develops its technological workforce.
In 2019, the Partnership launched our first Artificial Intelligence Federal Leadership Cohort (AI cohort), in which members of the Senior Executive Service (SES) from across government attend a six-month program designed to help agency decision-makers better understand the opportunities around AI and prepare leaders to integrate AI technology with policy objectives. In total, these 20 executives are responsible for leading hundreds of thousands of federal employees and oversee a collective budget of more than one trillion dollars. As the Partnership expands our work in the technology space, we are intentionally growing this program to create lasting and scalable change in government.
We are seeking a dynamic, collaborative and motivated professional to support the expansion and execution of the AI cohort over the next three years to eventually reach 150 SES leaders both in the Washington, DC area and in other regions where federal employees are heavily concentrated. In addition, this position may provide support for other technology programming that contributes to the Partnership’s mission more broadly.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
With senior-level oversight, manage deliverables and logistics of the AI cohort program and other large projects.
Organize events and convenings with federal employees and other cross-sector stakeholders.
Build and maintain relationships with federal and private sector stakeholders to enable the long-term success of the AI cohort program.
Coordinate and facilitate internal planning meetings and project meetings with external partners.
Analyze evaluation data pertaining to our technology programming, offering a point of view and making recommendations to maximize impact and solve problems.
Synthesize information and use it to create a clear and concise approach to executing work and deliverables.
Effectively connect the Partnership’s leadership and technology programming to our broader mission.
Demonstrate developed written, oral and presentational skills, managing external and internal program communications.
KEY COMPETENCIES
Relationship management with government leaders, external facilitators, corporate partners and program support staff.
Project management skills.
Analytical thinking.
Communication skills, both written and oral.
Proficiency using Microsoft Office suite of software, particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience with Salesforce or other client relationship management system a plus.
Collaborative team-player able to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Ability to organize multiple and varied assignments.
Excellent attention to detail, quality and value.
Demonstrated passion for, and commitment to, public service, and an interest in the mission of the Partnership.
KEY COMPETENCIES
Excellent communication, analytical, writing and presentation skills.
Strong relationship building and management skills with external and internal stakeholders.
Excellent attention to detail, quality and value.
Strong project management skills, with demonstrated ability to work under pressure and manage various priorities and deadlines.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and to organize multiple and varied projects simultaneously.
Flexibility, a can-do attitude and willingness to pitch in.
Passion for the mission of the Partnership for Public Service and our nonpartisan values.
REQUIRED/PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent professional work or military experience required.
Minimum of two to four years of professional experience required.
Familiarity using Microsoft Office, especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and SharePoint required.
Experience working in the federal environment or consulting preferred.
Familiarity with program evaluation preferred.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY/REPORTING STRUCTURE
This position reports to a senior manager or manager.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
This job operates in a professional office environment in Washington, DC, and at external venues, both local and out-of-state. This position requires consistent use of office equipment such as computer, telephone, printer and scanner. Please note that as a result of COVID-19, Partnership staff are currently working remotely.
POSITION TYPE/EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK
This is a full-time position with regular work hours Monday-Friday, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Occasional evening or weekend activities may be required as well. Please note that as a result of COVID-19, the Partnership is allowing maximum flexibility in work schedules.
TRAVEL
If travel occurs, it is usually during the business day. Local travel to various federal agencies may be required. Occasional out of the area and/or overnight travel will be required as well.
SALARY AND BENEFITS
The Partnership offers a compensation package that includes a competitive salary; medical, dental and vision coverage; life insurance; long- and short-term disability insurance; a 401(k) program with a 4 percent employer match; opportunities for training and development; 15 days of vacation leave per year, 10 days of sick leave per year, plus all federal holidays and the day after Thanksgiving off; and subsidized use of an on-site exercise facility.
AAP/EEO STATEMENT
The Partnership is an inclusive organization that fosters learning, collaboration and respect. We actively recruit for diversity in our workplace, believing that a range of backgrounds, perspectives and experiences contributes to our mission of revitalizing government. The Partnership for Public Service is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicants for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability; or on any other basis prohibited by law.

Description:

Our client is THE global leader of entertainment and technology. Among their key initiatives are interactive entertainment such as gaming, artificial intelligence, cloud services, film entertainment, and other internet services. Some of their best of breed International partners and investment companies include Epic Games, Riot, Activision, Take-Two and EA.

Our client is dedicated to creating a reliable, fun, and professional interactive entertainment experience for users through the creation of world class online games. If you are eager to do groundbreaking work in a friendly, cross-cultural environment, they can provide unparalleled stability, resources, access to more than a billion users, and an international perspective.

Job Description:
Our Award-winning client seeks an Audio Director with outstanding skills who can really help us build a new world-class IP from concept to market!

Are you ready to create something groundbreaking, genre-defining and fun for years to come? Do you have an insatiable passion for video games and creating new ways for players to be engaged?

Responsibilities:

Start with a player-first mentality, embedding an obsessive drive to know, understand, and serve the players who are engaged with the game.
Work with the team to develop and manage a vision of sound and music, and a production plan capable of delivering upon the promise of the game.
Keep up-to-date with the bleeding edge of audio trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product.
Participate in the hiring of the audio discipline.
Responsible for the career growth and mentorship of the audio discipline on the project.
Act as the key art contact for the studio, representing the project and team to all external partners and stakeholders.
Define and uphold audio principles to ensure the sound and music direction of the game is cohesive, inspiring, and with distinct style.
Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem solving.
Proactively identify opportunities and risks to improve the work of the team, the quality of the project, and studio knowledge as a whole.
Have a cross platform mindset up front and ensure that the art of the game is capable of supporting an experience that can work seamlessly on different systems and form factors.
Ensure that the audio direction of the game starts with a Live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary.

Requirements:
A portfolio of visionary, inspiring, industry-leading audio work that demonstrates your audio direction and capacity to execute on it within a game.
At least eight years of professional AAA game development experience.
At least two projects shipped in a leadership position.
At least one AAA action title shipped.
At least one product shipped during the current generation of games (PS4/XBOX ONE).
Demonstrable, outstanding management and communication capabilities.
Proven ability to define and manage the sound direction and roadmap for very large scale projects.
A team player who knows how to get the best out of everyone on the project and not just within audio.
Experience creating assets in and shipping a game using Unreal Engine 4 a plus

What is in it for you?

Create high-quality games backed by unlimited resources: You will be working to bring incredible game ideas to market, and you will never run out of resources at your disposal. You will be supported completely to bring next-gen experience live to players around the world!
Make a major impact at a global studio: You will be working on a key initiative at this global Studio, building games that are hits not just in the east or west, but globally. The impact of your efforts will ripple not just through the whole studio group (2,500+ employees) but will serve as a blueprint for the entire gaming industry.

To obtain more details or explore this job; please submit a copy of your resume by e-mailing: resumes@gamegrouprecruit.com.

Keep up to date with the bleeding edge of technical trends within video game development and evangelize solutions that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product.
Participate in the hiring of the entire engineering discipline.
Responsible for the career growth and mentorship of the engineering discipline on the project.
Act as the key engineering contact for the studio, representing the project and team to all external partners and stakeholders.
Define and uphold coding standards to minimize waste, maximize stability and keep content creators working.
Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem solving.
Proactively identify opportunities and risks to improve the work of the team, the quality of the project, and studio knowledge as a whole.
Have a cross platform mindset up front and ensure that the codebase can support an experience that can work seamlessly on different platforms and form factors.
Ensure that the technology of the game starts with a Live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key engineering changes if necessary.

Requirements:

A presentation of your work as an engineering leader, explaining key technology decisions you have made and an ability to be able to educate team members outside of the engineering discipline about those decisions.
At least eight years of professional AAA game development experience.
At least two projects shipped in a leadership position.
At least two AAA action titles shipped, one during the current generation of video games (PS4/XBOX ONE).
Demonstrable, outstanding management and communication capabilities.
Proven ability to define and manage the engineering vision and roadmap for very large-scale projects.
Expert knowledge with the C/C++ language.
A team player who knows how to get the best out of everyone on the project and not just within engineering.
Experience developing in and extending Unreal Engine 4 a plus.

What is in it for you?

Create high-quality games backed by unlimited resources: You will be working to bring incredible game ideas to market, and you will never run out of resources at your disposal. You will be supported completely to bring next-gen experience live to players around the world!
Make a major impact at a global studio: You will be working on a key initiative at this global Studio, building games that are hits not just in the east or west, but globally. The impact of your efforts will ripple not just through the whole studio group (2,500+ employees) but will serve as a blueprint for the entire gaming industry.

To obtain more details or explore this job; please submit a copy of your resume by e-mailing: resumes@gamegrouprecruit.com.
